conclusion: Pressure-volume diagram of an ideal gas undergoing a cycle ABCDA
State A is at pressure P1 and volume V1
State D is at pressure P1 and volume V2
Transition from D to A is represented by a horizontal line, indicating constant pressure
Work done by the gas on the surroundings during a process is given by W = ∫ P dV
During D→A transition, pressure remains constant at P1, so W_{D→A} = P1 ∫ dV = P1 (V1 - V2)
V2 > V1 as seen from the diagram, indicating volume is decreasing during transition
W_{D→A} = P1 (V1 - V2) = -P1(V2 - V1), negative sign indicates work is done on the gas
Final answer: Work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from D to A is -P1(V2 - V1)
